001package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.controller;
002
003import android.os.Bundle;
004import android.view.LayoutInflater;
005import android.view.View;
006import android.view.ViewGroup;
007import android.widget.ArrayAdapter;
008import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
009import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
010import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
011import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
012import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
013import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.adapter.ScoresAdapter;
014import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel.GameResultViewModel;
015
016/**
017 * Handles and inflates the scores screen.
018 */
019@AndroidEntryPoint
020public class ScoresFragment extends Fragment {
021
022  private edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.databinding.FragmentScoresBinding binding;
023
024  @Nullable
025  @Override
026  public View onCreateView(@NonNull LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable ViewGroup container,
027      @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
028    binding = edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.databinding.FragmentScoresBinding.inflate(inflater, container,
029        false);
030    return binding.getRoot();
031  }
032
033  @Override
034  public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
035    super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
036    new ViewModelProvider(this)
037        .get(GameResultViewModel.class)
038        .getall()
039        .observe(getViewLifecycleOwner(), (results) -> {
040          ScoresAdapter adapter = new ScoresAdapter(requireContext(), results);
041          binding.scores.setAdapter(adapter);
042        });
043  }
044}
